FacilityName: City of Mitchell Water Treatment Facility

Accident Release Prevention Policy



The City of Mitchell Water Treatment Facility (WTF) is a responsible member of the community and is committed to operating its facility in a safe and environmentally sound manner.  The Mitchell WTF utilizes its Risk Management Program to identify ways to reduce its use of hazardous materials and minimize potential risks to its employees, the community, and environment.



The City of Mitchell WTF will comply with applicable safety, health, and environmental regulations; identify, report, and promptly correct unsafe conditions; train personnel to safely perform their job duties; and work to maintain a safe workplace.



Description of Stationary and Substance Handled



The City of Mitchell WTF has implemented a Level 2 Risk Management Program to prevent the accidental release of chlorine from it's plant at 2800 North Mains St in Mitchell, South Dakota.  At this location, the City of Mitchell operates a water treatment facility to provide safe potable drinking water to the citizens of Mitchell.   Chlorine is used to reduce the pathogenic (disease causing) bacteria and viruses to below the maximum contaminant level s set forth in the Safe Drinking Water Act.  Chlorine can be stored in quantities that exceed EPA's regulatory threshold.



General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



The City of Mitchell relies on several safeguards as part of its accidental release prevention program.  The City of Mitchell designers and suppliers use recognized design codes and standards for the equipment and system components; standard operating procedures specify safe practices used at the plant; a maintenance program establishes proper testing, calibration, and cleaning procedures.  Also hazard communication occurs frequently between management, operators, and employees during the process safety information review, training, safety briefings, and the annual program review. 



Five Year Accident History

The City of Mitchell WTF has not had any reportable accidents or releases of chlorine that resulted in any on-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on-site; nor any off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage in the previous five years.



Emergency Response



The City of Mitchell WTF Emergency Action Plan has been coordinated with the Davison County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC), the Mitchell Fire Department and it provides guidance for the notification, response and evacuation of WTF employees.  The emergency action plan acknowledges the LEPC as the emergency coordinators and recognizes the Mitchell Fire Department as the first responders.



Process Safety Improvements



The City of Mitchell WTF regularly participation in safety related activities results in safety improvements at the facility.  WTF regularly participates in training and internal facility safety reviews; hosts the local Fire Department during facility walk through, conducts regular pipe integrity testing, and offers WTF employees awareness level, initial and refresher training on the chlorine disinfection system.  This Risk Management Plan and information used to prepare it are readily available to all City of Mitchell WTF employees.
